title: Exploratory Data Analysis of Diabetes Health Indicators
text: This analysis aims to explore the Diabetes Health Indicators dataset to understand the relationships between various health indicators and the presence of diabetes. The ultimate goal is to use these insights to build predictive models.

title: Exploratory Data Analysis of Diabetes Health Indicators
text: This analysis aims to explore the Diabetes Health Indicators dataset to understand the relationships between various health indicators and the presence of diabetes. The ultimate goal is to use these insights to build predictive models.

title: Exploratory Data Analysis of Diabetes Health Indicators
text:
Data
Let’s load the dataset and perform initial exploration.

# Load the necessary libraries
library(tidyverse)

data <- read.csv("C:/Users/karen/Downloads/diabetes_binary_health_indicators_BRFSS2015.csv")

title: Exploratory Data Analysis of Diabetes Health Indicators
text:
Data Cleaning and Transformation
We need to clean and transform the data for our analysis.

# Convert relevant columns to factors
data <- data %>%
  mutate(across(where(is.numeric), as.factor))

# Check for missing values
sum(is.na(data))

[1] 0

title: Exploratory Data Analysis of Diabetes Health Indicators
Exploratory Data Analysis of Diabetes Health Indicators
text:
Visualizations
Let’s create some visualizations to understand the relationships between variables.

# Example visualization
ggplot(data, aes(x = factor(HighBP), fill = factor(Diabetes_binary))) +
  geom_bar(position = "dodge") +
  labs(title = "High Blood Pressure vs Diabetes", x = "High Blood Pressure", y = "Count", fill = "Diabetes")
